availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sidney Smith Grimes (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and physician)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. Kentucky native. Son of Charles Grimes and Jane Winn Grimes. Married to Lydia “Jane” Ann Gess McCann on November 20, 1834. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Physician in Fayette County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 239B
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Athens, p. 450.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 10A
Alabama Surname Files, Alabama Department of Archives and History, Montgomery, Alabama, Film M84-4746.
